page.title: 09By the River Arrow in June
page.content: Walking by the River Arrow you hear birds singing, the wind gently blowing through the trees and the river trickling along, after tumbling over a small waterfall. You can see a black bridge and its reflection in the water. A disused railway track goes over the bridge. People take their dogs for walks along there and some go jogging in their tracksuits. You see people fishing in the river, sitting among many different wild flowers and grasses. Across the river, on the Grammar School playing field, you may hear children's voices as they play cricket, or hockey and rugby in winter. If you walk on upstream you pass a market garden with fields full of lettuce. The river path then goes through a lot of very tall nettles and comes out in pasture land by a weir. Take your wellies and have a good day!
